cellularAutomata.cellState.model
Class LatticeGasState

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.cellState.model.CellState
      cellularAutomata.cellState.model.IntegerVectorState
          cellularAutomata.cellState.model.LatticeGasState

public class LatticeGasState
extends IntegerVectorState

State for hexagonal lattice gas automatons. Is a vector of length 7. Six array positions are for particles (a 0 means a particle is not present and a 1 means a particle is present). The last array position indicates whether or not the state is a wall (a 0 if it is not a wall and a 1 if it is a wall).
This code assumes hexagonal lattices.

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

LatticeGasState

public LatticeGasState()
Note that this constructor calls the non-default super constructor to ensure that the vector length is correctly set. The program will crash otherwise (when it gets a 0 length vector).

LatticeGasState

public LatticeGasState(int[] state)
Creates a vector state with permissible values of 0 and 1.

Method Detail

clone

public CellState clone()
Creates a clone of this cellState; this method must return a different instance of the cell state, but with all the same values.

The intent is that, for any CellState x, the expression: x.clone() != x will be true, and that the expression: x.clone().getClass() == x.getClass() will be true. Also: x.clone().equals(x) will be true.

(Note this method is used in places where we need a copy of the cell's state but that the same instance would cause unpredictable or incorrect behavior.)

Overrides:
clone in class IntegerVectorState
Returns:
A unique copy of the cell's state (must not return "this" object).

isAlternate

public boolean isAlternate()
Overrides the parent class to test if the CellState is "alternate" which in this case is a wall.

Overrides:
isAlternate in class IntegerVectorState
Returns:
true if the state is alternate (a wall).
See Also:
CellState.setToAlternateState()

isFull

public boolean isFull()
Tests if a given CellState is "full". A full state is anything other than an empty state. This differs somewhat from most other CA, where "full" would indicate a maximum possible value. In this case, if any site has a 1, then it is full (excluding the last array position, the wall site).

Overrides:
isFull in class IntegerVectorState
Returns:
true if the state is full.
See Also:
setToFullState()

setToAlternateState

public void setToAlternateState()
Overrides the parent class method to sets an alternate state which is a wall.

Overrides:
setToAlternateState in class IntegerVectorState

setToFullState

public void setToFullState()
Overrides the parent class method because in a lattice gas, a "full" state just means that a site has at least one particle. So we set particles randomly, but make sure it isn't all 0's.

Overrides:
setToFullState in class IntegerVectorState
See Also:
CellState.setToFullState()

setToRandomState

public void setToRandomState(double probability)
Sets a random integer vector for this cell state.

Overrides:
setToRandomState in class IntegerVectorState
Parameters:
probability - The probability that a particle is present in each of the state's 6 directions.
